creator: deidreeastcomm@hotmail.com
text:
I would like for someone to add the VSS purge command to the list of available 
tasks for VSS.  Allowing purging recursively would be a must.  At this point, 
one would need to run the following commands to begin to attempt automation of 
the purging of a project and the subprojects below it.

To get the list of CIs...
  ss Dir <vss project>/* -D -R 
To actual purge a CI...
  ss Purge <vss project>/<configuration item>

creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
Seems a reasonable wish, though I should note that support for any SCM system
other than CVS and SVN is very patchy. All SCM systems need to be maintained by
developers with copies of the relevant system, and as VSS is neither free nor
any good (personal opinion, based on painful experience), few/none of the active
ant developers work with it.

You will probably need to write it yourself. SCM tasks are also a dog to write
tests for, but they are needed too.
